messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Camps
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Tom This really Helps !! Tom Hatfield  wrote: i found this site while looking for armor making instructions, it has some stuff
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Tom
This really Helps !!

Tom Hatfield <oneundeadlord@...> wrote:
i found this site while looking for armor making instructions, it has some stuff about camps.

hope it helps

http://www.sengokudaimyo.com/miscellany/miscellany.html

then scroll down untill you find the button labeled "japanese camps"






Tom Hatfield

"In all forms of stratagy, it is necessary to maintain the combat stance in everyday life, and to make your everyday stance your combat stance."

-Miyamoto Musashi, The Book of Five Rings,

The Water Book

messages.subject: Camps
messages.msgSnippet: Okay I have more questions. During campaign did the Samurai armies set up camps ? Did they have tents ? A bagage train ? and what were their rations like ? I
messages.messageBody:
Okay I have more questions. During campaign did the Samurai armies
set up camps ? Did they have tents ? A bagage train ? and what were
their rations like ? I have seen paintings of their Head quarters in
the field but thats it. Their soldiers would have been in the open at
night and exsposed to the weather with out some protection.I am
building an impression and need to know this. During Living history
displays I would like to set up some type of small camp. Thanks !!!

Takara
